intro: Clemensiella omlori, commonly known as the Omlori clemensiella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
